Container.Name: rclone
Container.Overview: Rclone is a command line program to sync files and directories to and from cloud provider
Container.Description: Rclone is a command line program to sync files and directories to and from cloud provider

Config.Name: Variable: SYNC_SRC
Config.Description: source location for rclone sync/copy/move command

Config.Name: Variable: SYNC_DEST
Config.Description: destination location for rclone sync/copy/move command

Config.Name: Variable: SYNC_OPTS
Config.Description: additional options for rclone sync/copy/move command. Defaults to -v

Config.Name: Variable: SYNC_OPTS_EVAL
Config.Description: further additional options for rclone sync/copy/move command. The variables and commands in the string are first interpolated like in a shell. The interpolated string is appended to SYNC_OPTS. That means '--backup-dir /old`date -I`' first evaluates to '--backup-dir /old2019-09-12', which is then appended to SYNC_OPTS. The evaluation happens immediately before rclone is called.

Config.Name: Variable: SYNC_ONCE
Config.Description: set variable to only run the sync one time and then exit the container

Config.Name: Variable: RCLONE_CMD
Config.Description: set variable to sync copy or move when running rclone. Defaults to sync

Config.Name: Variable: RCLONE_DIR_CMD
Config.Description: set variable to ls or lsf for source directory check style. Defaults to ls

Config.Name: Variable: RCLONE_DIR_CHECK_SKIP
Config.Description: set variable to skip source directory check before sync. Use with caution

Config.Name: Variable: CRON
Config.Description: crontab schedule 0 0 * * * to perform sync every midnight. Also supprorts cron shortcuts: @yearly @monthly @weekly @daily @hourly

Config.Name: Variable: CRON_ABORT
Config.Description: crontab schedule 0 6 * * * to abort sync at 6am

Config.Name: Variable: FORCE_SYNC
Config.Description: set variable to perform a sync upon boot

Config.Name: Variable: CHECK_URL
Config.Description: healthchecks.io url or similar cron monitoring to perform a GET after a successful sync

Config.Name: Variable: FAIL_URL
Config.Description: Fail URL to perform a GET after unsuccessful execution. By default this is CHECK_URL with appended '/fail' at the end

Config.Name: Variable: OUTPUT_LOG
Config.Description: set variable to output log file to /logs

Config.Name: Variable: ROTATE_LOG
Config.Description: set variable to delete logs older than specified days from /logs
